description.general: The s1kd-flatten tool combines a publication module and the data modules it references into a single file for use with a publishing system. Data modules are by default searched for in the current directory using the data module code, language and/or issue info provided in each reference.

option.name: -c, --containers
option.description: Flatten referenced container data modules by copying the references inside the container directly into the publication module. The copied references will also be flattened, unless the -m option is specified.

option.name: -D, --remove
option.description: Remove unresolved references.

option.name: -d, --dir <dir>
option.description: Directory to start search in. By default, the current directory is used.

option.name: -f, --overwrite
option.description: Overwrite input publication module instead of writing to stdout.

option.name: -h, -?, --help
option.description: Show help/usage message.

option.name: -I, --include <path>
option.description: Add <path> to the list of directories that the tool will search when resolving references.

option.name: -i, --ignore-issue
option.description: Always match the latest issue of an object found, regardless of the issue specified in the reference.

option.name: -m, --modify
option.description: Modify the references in the publication module without flattening them.

option.name: -N, --omit-issue
option.description: Assume that the files representing the referenced data modules do not include the issue info in their filenames, i.e. they were created using the -N option of the s1kd-new* tools.

option.name: -P, --only-pm-refs
option.description: Only flatten PM references, leaving DM references alone.

option.name: -p, --simple
option.description: Instead of the hierarchical PM-based format, use a simpler "flat" format.

option.name: -q, --quiet
option.description: Quiet mode. Errors are not printed.

option.name: -R, --recursively
option.description: Recursively flatten referenced publication modules, copying their content into the "master" publication module.

option.name: -r, --recursive
option.description: Search directories recursively.

option.name: -u, --unique
option.description: Remove duplicate references within the PM content.

option.name: -v, --verbose
option.description: Verbose output. Specify multiple times to increase the verbosity.

option.name: -x, --use-xinclude
option.description: Use XInclude rather than copying each data module's contents directly inside the publication module. DTD entities in data modules will only be carried over to the final publication when using this option, otherwise they do not carry over when copying the data module.

option.name: --version
option.description: Show version information.

option.name: <DM>...
option.description: When using the -p option, the filenames to include can be specified manually as additional arguments instead of searching for them in the current directory. When not using the -p option, additional arguments are ignored.

option.name: <PM>
option.description: The publication module to flatten.

option.name: --dtdload
option.description: Load the external DTD.

option.name: --huge
option.description: Remove any internal arbitrary parser limits.

xmlParserOptions.option: --net <description.Allow network access to load external DTD and entities.

option.name: --noent
option.description: Resolve entities.

option.name: --parser-errors
option.description: Emit errors from parser.

option.name: --xinclude
option.description: Do XInclude processing.

option.name: --xml-catalog <file>
option.description: Use an XML catalog when resolving entities. Multiple catalogs may be loaded by specifying this option multiple times.

exitStatus.description: The publication module specified is malformed.
